thread.title: ‘University Challenge' Contestant Sends Twitter Into A Spin With Bizarre Degree Subject
thread.title_full: ‘University Challenge' Contestant Sends Twitter Into A Spin With Bizarre Degree Subject

author: Rachel McGrath
title: ‘University Challenge' Contestant Sends Twitter Into A Spin With Bizarre Degree Subject
text:
‘University Challenge' Contestant Sends Twitter Into A Spin With Bizarre Degree Subject The Huffington Post UK | By Rachel McGrath reddit 
‘University Challenge’ has provided us with plenty of snigger-worthy moments over the years, but we reckon the show has just outdone itself thanks to contestant Kate Lynes, who happily announced that she’s studying for a degree in “sphincter preservation” in Monday night's episode. 
Yes, seriously... 
— Mark Pyper (@markpyper) October 5, 2015 
Naturally, Twitter couldn’t wait to have a few laughs following the Queen Mary student’s introduction, and barely a minute passed before the joke’s started rolling in, as distracted viewers struggled to keep their minds on the show’s tough questions… An MD in sphincter preservation? #universityhaschangedsincemyday 
— David Baddiel (@Baddiel) October 5, 2015 I spent so long reading about sphincter preservation that I missed the first few questions. #UniversityChallenge 
— The Media Blog (@TheMediaTweets) October 5, 2015 In case you missed the TV highlight of the year #UniversityChallenge this evening. pic.twitter.com/CfuqmFBqH0 
— George Mann (@SGFMann) October 5, 2015 Is #sphinctorpreservation all one word or is there a colon in there? #universitychallenge 
— Peter Smith (@Redpeter99) October 5, 2015 
Thankfully, the university put a stop to the silliness, by providing more information on Kate’s degree: Twitter: stop giggling about @QMUL PhD in #SphincterPreservation . It's vital research. Read: http://t.co/wcFYgkNMdi . #UniversityChallenge 
— QMUL English & Drama (@QMULsed) October 5, 2015 
This isn’t the first time the current series of ‘University Challenge’ has turned heads, as earlier this year, student Kamil Shah stunned viewers with his uhhh, interesting ensemble of choice: a pleather vest. 
Sadly, his sartorial sassiness wasn't enough to impress host Jeremy Paxman, and his university King's lost to rival Cambridge college Sidney Sussex. Close 10 University Challenge Best Moments Of All Time of  Definitely not this one. while it would probably take most people about three minutes to finally spell that word right. Exactly. You must eventually be right like this contestant. It turns out you need more than smart to win. and almost fluffed it in 1980. And the secret is modular arithmetic, which only works that fast if you're that smart. 'What else is it going to be?', said Ralph. Ugh... Keep buzzing anyway. He made a contestant repeatedly apologise for a wrong answer. At least they would've got it right in this question.  Share
